project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When defining the status order for an agile board in {{Configure > Column Management}} ,
 the order is not reflected in the board accordingly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an Agile Board
 # {{Configure > Column Management}}
 # Configure as below
 # !column_management.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

When viewing in the board , it should follow the order of the status configured in column management
h3. Actual Results

The order is not followed.
 !board2.png|thumbnail! 
 !kanban_view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The status order on the column follow the step id of each issue's workflow. Steps with a lower id will appear on top than those with higher (later) ids.
 A workaround to edit the steps' ids has been published on this KB:
 * [How to reorder statuses on board columns in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-reorder-statuses-on-board-columns-in-jira-1005792525.html]

It consists of updating the {{descriptor}} column of the {{jiraworkflows}} table to change the content inside the XML representation of the steps' ids.
fields.summary: Status in Board Column is not in Order

fields.description:
In this issue https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JC-778. Usage of that key is being removed from Jira Core so there is no need for Software to keep setting it.
Currently the key is being used in com/atlassian/greenhopper/service/properties/UserPropertyServiceImpl.java (get & set)

If Software itself is using it that usage should be removed, you can read about strategies here https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/2015/11/25/Session+removal+learning+for+zero-downtime+upgrades

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Having the ability to set constraints on the different columns for controlling the WIP and flow through the process is a good thing, however, with a mid-sized team of around 10 people, I'd really like the option of making the constraint values on a column be "Per-user" constraints.  If it could be adjustable for each column on the board, so much the better.  Currently if I set the MAX constraint to "N" (Number of team members), assuming WIP for each user should be 1, then if a user has 2, but the value is still under "N", the constraint would not be violated, even though the intended constraint is being breached.  

There might also need to be some changes made on how that user shows up in the swimlanes/columns, so this may be more than just a simple change.

I hope this is clear, but if not, please contact me at mark.galbraith@citrix.com for clarification.
fields.summary: Allow per-user constraint configuration on Kanban/Scrum boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According the documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2015/12/jira-software-sprint-management-first-release
{quote}
As previously blogged, we're now shipping the first release of the Manage Sprints permission changes on 6th December 2015. With the first release, the Manage Sprints permission will be created, and existing users with the Administer Project permission will be assigned the new permission for the same projects. The same sprint actions will check for the new permission, so it will be business as usual.
The following sprint-related actions will now be assigned to specific users in your team, thereby separating these from the actions that come with the Administer Project permission:
* Creating sprints
* Starting sprints
* Completing sprints
* Editing sprint information (sprint name and dates)
* Reordering sprints  (currently only future sprints)
* Deleting sprints (currently only future sprints)
* Reopening sprints
* Moving the sprint footer
{quote}

Users should now be able to manage Sprints, this include Starting and completing sprints, by only having this new implemented permission: "Manage Sprints" permission.
However, some users who have both "Manage Sprints" and "Administer Projects" are not being able to fulfil any of the actions above unless they are also *"JIRA Administrators"*, a permission that shouldn't be needed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and a new project;
# Create a user with only Manage Sprints permission on this project;
# Try to start the Sprint with this user.

h3. Expected Results
Having the *Manage Sprints* permission should be enough to enable the user to complete the actions described above.

h3. Actual Results
Even with *Manage Sprints*, *Edit Issue*, *Schedule issue* and *Administer Projects* over all projects retrieved by the board's filter, the user can't start/complete

h3. Workarounds

*Suggested*
* Provide user "Manage Sprint" permission across all permission schemes

*Alternatives*
* Create another temporary board without any sub query Eg: {{Project = TEST order by RANK ASC}}, create the sprint there. Use quick filter to filter the fields instead. 
* To start sprint, get administrator to initiate the sprint at this moment.
* Provide a user "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission to Start/Stop any sprint
fields.summary: Cannot start/close sprint since latest Cloud release

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Project admin unable to create sprint or stop sprint, below error is seen:
{noformat}
You need the Manage Sprints permission for all the projects in the origin board to create a sprint
{noformat}

When you have filter query of labels that span across other project where the same user is not a project administrator of. This happen despite having the filter constructed with project specific, for more information refer to the steps to replicate below.

h2. Steps to replicate

# Create 2 projects with 1 issue each on the project (Project A and Project B)
# Create a label (example of the field) and mark it on the issue for both project (example: {{labeling}})
# Grant the user for test project administration and manage sprint permission of project A
# Ensure that the user have no such permission for project B
# Create a board with query below:
{noformat}
project = "Project A" and labels in (labeling) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Load the board for test user that follow the criteria given for step 3 and step 4

h2. Expected result

User able to create sprint, since the filter should only return issues from project A

h2. Actual result

User unable to create sprint, error is seen

h2. Workarounds

*Suggested*
* Provide user "Manage Sprint" permission across all permission schemes

*Alternatives*
* Create another temporary board without any sub query Eg: {{Project = TEST order by RANK ASC}}, create the sprint there. Use quick filter to filter the fields instead. 
* To start sprint, get administrator to initiate the sprint at this moment.
* Provide a user "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission to Start/Stop any sprint

h2. Affected Version

{{7.1.8-D20151201T145156}} Detected on JIRA Software Cloud
fields.summary: User with permission not able to Start Sprint or Stop Sprint when Sub Query contain issue from different project

fields.description:
Allow the negation of a quick filter without copying or modifying the quick filter.
Example quick filter "Bugs" JQL: _type = Bug_
Just allow *three state* of a *quick filter*:
1. {color:#707070}Not Active{color} --> JQL: ""
2. {color:#14892c}Active{color} --> JQL: "_type = Bug_"
3. {color:#d04437}Active negation{color} --> JQL: "_NOT type = Bug_" - Adds a "NOT " to the JQL of the quick filter.
fields.summary: Provide negation ("not") in quick filter (agile board)

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Link to Issue Navigator from version page gives unreadable query}}

In JIRA 7.0, the version screen provides a series of tabs across the top for "Issues In Version", "Issues Done", "Issues in Progress", etc.

When on one of those issue listings, there is a link right above the table for "View in Issue Navigator". However, when that happens, the query it takes you to is in "Advanced" mode where it displays the raw JQL and the Basic button is greyed out. In addition, it utilizes the numeric IDs for project/version. For example, if I click that link when on the "Issues in Version" tab, I get:
project = 10020 AND fixVersion = 12960 ORDER BY priority DESC, key ASC

This makes it very hard to then further refine the query.

This is in contrast to the "good" query you get when you are on an issue page for an existing issue and click on the version number. It uses the Basic view, and the URL shows that the query used the NAMES of the project and versions.
fields.summary: Version page to Issue Navigator link query should be readable or use Basic search

*Workaround:*

Similar case: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32634

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
Full load Agile Board in IE 11 lasts for 17 seconds, load that same Board in Google Chrome takes 5 seconds, in Firefox takes 6 seconds.

h3. Steps to Replicate

*Scenario 1*
# Use JIRA Agile 6.7.11
# Use Internet Explorer v11.0.9600.18059
# Use Google Chrome v46.0.2490.86
# Use Mozilla Firefox v37.0.2
# Create 30 test boards
# Visit the same Agile Boards on IE11, Chrome and FF and compare load time.
# Populate the project that associated with the board with Epics and Versions. The more element here will slow down IE11 even further.

*Scenario 2 - took more than 40 seconds to load a board*
# The board consists of one sprint with 100 issues, and the backlog returns 400+ issues.
# The board contains 60+ projects, and is build using the below filter query:
{code}
(category = Scrum) or project not in (albifrons, albifrons, albifrons) AND issuetype not in (Bug, Test, Pre-Condition, Incident, Pre-Condition, "Service Request") AND status in (Open, "In Progress", Closed, Escalated, Done, Open, "In Progress", Implementing) AND labels = Scrum ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# If running the filter above in Issue Navigator page, its returning 3k+ issues.

h3. Expected Result
Agile Board loading time will be about the same on all browsers.

h3. Actual Result
Loading IE11 is too slow.

How dramatically speed up loading Agile Boards in IE 11?
fields.summary: Slow loading Agile boards in IE11

fields.description:
JIRA v6.4.12
JIRA Agile v6.7.11

We regularly move issues between sprints by editing the sprint field in the edit issue dialog, this is no longer working correctly with our recent JIRA upgrade to the aforementioned version.

Prerequisite: There are two sprints: November, December.  Issue is in sprint November.

1. Edit issue
2. Delete sprint "November" from Sprint field
3. Type in new sprint name "December"
4. Click "Update"
5. Notice on the issue page under Active Sprints both "November" and "December" are listed
6. Notice the issue shows up in both "November" and "December" sprint boards
7. Edit the issue again
8. Notice only "December" is shown in the sprint field
9. Go to the Backlog page
10. Notice the issue is only listed in the "November" sprint

Another issue, Cannot remove an issue from sprint.
1. Edit issue
2. Delete sprint text
3. Click Update
4. Notice on the issue page under Active Sprints the original sprint is still listed
fields.summary: Editing sprint puts issue in multiple sprints, only one shown in edit dialog

# Navigate to board B

{{Only My Issues}} quick filter is remembered and selected.

Manually select/click {{Only My Issues}} quick filter

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When you try to access an older version report for example {{https://ATLASSIAN_URL/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=219&projectKey=TEST&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=23000}}, it will not load the report for version 23000 but instead the browser will redirect the link to {{https://ATLASSIAN_URL/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=219&projectKey=TEST&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=23801}} (which is the latest).

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Load an older version report from your browser

h3.Expected Result
The older version report is loaded correctly.

h3.Current Result
The older version is not loaded; instead the URL redirects to the latest version report.

JIRA v6.3.8, JIRA Agile v6.6.13
1. Go to project Overview>Versions (or project Administration>Versions) and observe a release date for certain version (in my example on the screenshot1.jpg it will be 22/Jan/15)
2. Go to appropriate Agile board where this release will be represented, expand versions from the left, and observe the date of the same release 
---
Release date will be shown one day back (in my example on the second screenshot2.jpg it will be Release Date: 21/Jan/15)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
We simply need to make JIRA's "Default user time zone" mismatch with Java's recognized "System Default". Let's assume the current Java "System Default" is: America/Los_Angeles (GMT -7)

h5. Reproduce 1
# Create a new Agile board, using the Sample Scrum Project
** This will automatically include versions with release dates
# Within JIRA, modify JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > Default user time zone
# Change the region to "Australia" and "GMT +8"
# Now compare the version dates on the Agile Board vs. the Project administration page - notice that they are a day off

h5. Reproduce 2
# Modify the JVM parameters to include: {{-Duser.timezone=Australia/Perth}}

h3. Workaround
Ensure that both "Default user time zone" and JVM timezone match

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, a person is allowed to manage a sprint (start/stop them, add/remove issues, etc.) if they have the required combination of project permissions in all projects "visible" to a sprint. While [#GHS-5035] will change how these permissions are structured, the permissions are still entirely governed by whether the user has permissions in a particular project or set of projects. This means there is no way for sprints/boards/teams that work on the same project(s) to be unable to manage sprints that are not from their board. This causes several problems:

# Because only one sprint on a board can be open at a time, two teams working on the same project cannot work in separate sprints. I admit that this is not very "Scrum" but it is a *huge* problem for us. The current restrictions do not prevent work being done on the same project in different sprints anyway, you just need to have a second project on each board that differs between the two teams, i.e. Team 1 can work on Projects 1 and 2 while Team 2 work on Projects 2 and 3, but not if they both work only on Projects 1 and 2. N.B. There is a setting in JIRA Software Labs that can allow parallel sprints, please keep this feature!
# Issues can easily be added to the wrong sprint, and users are presented with many sprints they should not have to see when choosing a sprint.
# In our company we turn over a large number of small projects (one of the main reasons we have cross-functional teams that can collaborate on any specific project). Maintaining project-specific board filters for each board would be very complex and time consuming and very prone to issues getting "lost" if assigned to a user using a board that does not reference the relevant project, and nowhere near as elegant as an "assignee in membersOf(...)" type filter which is all that should be necessary for a team-centric board.

My argument is that Scrum boards and their associated sprints do not fundamentally map to a set of projects, they map to a particular team. In "pure" Scrum, a team works on a single project, and so there is an implied mapping from sprint to project which would mean project permissions would be sufficient to control who can manage a given set of sprints. However, JIRA Software is no longer called JIRA Agile and "Scrum" boards are based on any JQL query not on a list of projects, so I do not accept the notion that they are solely intended to be used with unique project mappings.

Hence, I believe there are two types of permission that need to be available:

* Issue-based permissions that decide whether the user can add *that* issue to *any* sprint. These are the permissions that are currently in place.
* Board-based permissions that decide whether the user can add *any* issue to *that* sprint. These are the permissions I would like to have implemented.

Some solutions that would be fine for us:

# Add a requirement that someone managing a sprint (starting/stopping/deleting/adding/removing/etc.) should not only have the project permissions already in place, but must also be an administrator on the "origin board" (see [#GHS-5035], [#comment-785773]) for that sprint. 
# Create a separate field on the board ("Scrum Masters" or "Sprint Managers"?) as opposed to using the existing Board Admin.

What would *not* be workable is to do it based on who the board filter is shared with. We need many more people to be able to view a board than to be able to manage it (obviously).

While planning, a user should only see sprints that they are able to manage, and they should be able to start that sprint even if other open sprints visible to the board but with a different origin board (that correspond to other teams working on the same project(s)) exist.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I want to be able to control who has permission to manage a particular sprint.

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
[JIRA Agile REST API Reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/latest/] does not contain any info about how to query Agile reports e.g. Velocity or Burndown.

However, there are available endpoints to achieve this, e.g.:
* for Velocity:
{code}/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/velocity?rapidViewId=<board_ID>{code}
* for Burndown:
{code}/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/scopechangeburndownchart?rapidViewId=<board_ID>&sprintId=<sprint_ID>{code}

A full list of report keywords usable for REST endpoints can be found in [this Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/243675/where-are-possible-chart-types-for-the-greenhopper-rest-api-documented].

h4. +Suggestion+
The documentation should be updated with this kind of information.
fields.summary: Update REST API doc with /rapid/charts endpoints

Only 1 version shows that it has issue in it

Found that it will display in the Version which was added the last.

No known workaround

Kanban is designed without Backlog, since there is no sprint planning in Kanban. This means that every issues belong to that board will be shown. This could lead to having to load many issues (based on board filter) at one time.

fields.description:
When a Kanban board is configured to have Epic Swimlanes, the board might not show all issues, as the only issues shown will match the epics that coincide with the board filter. If not all epics are shown, not all issues will be shown.

The issue caused is that the number above the columns on the board will always show the total number of issues, regardless of the number of issues that are shown after swimlanes are created. This will cause confusion for users, as the total in the column might report 17 issues, while only 5 might be visible based on what the swimlanes and filter show.

I am suggesting that we make that number more accurate when swimlanes are created. For example, a board without swimlanes might show something like "17 out of 17 issues shown", whereas once some issues disappear from the board when epic swimlanes are created, that number might show as "5 out of 17 issues shown" (the wording could of course be different).
fields.summary: Number above Kanban Column Should show Visible vs. Total

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The following behaviour has been reported by a user and tested by myself. This behavior is based on a Kanban board with the following filter: 

reporter = currentUser() ORDER BY Rank ASC

* The observations made refer to "you" and other users. Since the filter is based on the current user, "you" will refer to whatever user you are logged in as.
* The first three observations are the product working as it should. The fourth observation is where the product is causing an issue.

1. Subtasks you reported, under a task you also reported that does not have an epic link will show under the swimlane "Issues without epics". (The task will show under that swimlane as well).
2. Subtasks you reported, under a task you also reported, under an epic you reported will also show, under the swimlane associated with that epic.
3. Subtasks you reported, under a task you reported, under an epic reported by someone else will not show, as the subtask is going to inherit the epic link from the parent task, and this epic was not reported by you.

For each of these observations, you can see that it follows the hierarchy of Epic > Task > Subtask, which is as it should be.

Now, here is the behavior that is an issue:

4. A subtask reported by you, under a task reported BY ANOTHER USER, under an Epic reported BY ANOTHER USER, will in fact show up under the swimlane "Issues without epics". What this appears to show is that the subtask will not even look at the epic link of the parent task since it has been reported by another user, and based on your filter, will show in that swimlane.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* To see the behavior, make sure to have epics, tasks, and subtasks reported by the users that match each observation in the above summary.

# Create a Kanban board with the following filter: reporter = currentUser() ORDER BY Rank ASC
# Login as the "you" user referred to in the above observations.
# View board as is. You should see each task, subtask, and epic reported by you.
# Edit configuration of board by adding Epic Swimlanes.
# You will now see the above observations.


h3. Expected Results

The subtask created under observation #4 should not show up in the results, as the epic the parent task is linked to was not created by the current user. The subtask should look at the parent task and see that the parent IS linked to an epic and should not show at all. It is incorrect for the product to say that the subtask is without an epic.


h3. Actual Results

The subtask does show under the "Issues without epics" swimlane, which is incorrect.


h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Epic Swimlane Subtask Visibility is Inconsistent

User Story) is displayed in backlog view, and if sub-task are selected in the Board configuration to be displayed, and if number of sub-tasks is greater than a certain number (depending on screen resolution), then not all sub-tasks are displayed. Instead, ellipsis symbol is added after the last visible sub-task.

Accordingly, when this page is printed, only a certain number of sub-tasks is visible, more if page is printed in landscape mode, less if page is printed in portrait mode.

I suspect that it would be beneficial for many users, and certainly very beneficial for us, to have this feature designed in such a way that always all sub-tasks are displayed, by moving excessive number of sub-tasks into second, third, and so on... row.

Please see attached images.

The same would happen when page is printed, all sub-tasks would always be printed, regardless of the number of sub-tasks and paper orientation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Sprint Burndown gadget_ does not load any data on the dashboard.
Sometimes it's possible to make it load, but it's intermittent and doesn't seems to have anything else related.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-002

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add _Sprint Burndown gadget_ to the dashboard
# In gadget's configuration, select the board with the current active Sprint and _refresh interval_ is 15 minutes, Save.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should load the data

h3. Actual Results
The gadget does not load any data (blank)
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
# If you are the owner of the Dashboard: Click _Edit -> Cancel_ on the gadget configuration.
# If you are not, you can either:
-- Copy that dashboard and then click _Edit -> Cancel_ button Or
-- Ask the owner of the board to change the _Refresh Interval_ of the gadget to _15 minutes_, the data will be loaded after 15 minutes.

*Notes:*
This happens mainly on Google Chrome, also verified in Safari and IE.
Firefox can be used instead.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown gadget does not load any data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The sprint popup, that appears when right clicking an issue on an Agile Board, is not fully visible on a board that contains a huge number of sprints (~100), as it is partially hidden by the JIRA header. 
Validated that problem exists on multiple browsers. 
This cause users not to be able to add issues to the sprint which is hidden from the screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Backlog on an Agile Board that contains a huge number of sprints
# Right-click an issue. The popup will appear as below:
!board-sprint.png!

h3. Expected Results
The sprint popup would appear right below the selected issue.

h3. Actual Results
The sprint popup appears on the top of the page and is unavailable as the JIRA master header is on top of it.

h3. Notes
This is reproducible on the latest Chrome, Firefox and Safari versions (on 11/19/2015).

h3.Workaround
* Create a new board and setup it to use the same filter as the previous one. Since the sprints are tied to the boards, the newly created board won't contain a huge number of sprints.
fields.summary: Sprint popup is not fully visible on Agile board when backlog has several sprints

fields.description:
I have created a Support Request, and they haven't been able to help me, suggesting that I opened a dev support request:

While trying to follow the custom field type tutorial: [https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/guides/fields/tutorial-creating-a-custom-field-type]

I have found that there are some discrepancies between the process detailde in the tutorial and the actual process, one of them being the reference to a com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.example package, whereas the sdk creates com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.example.api and com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.example.impl packages.

Anyway, I'm sticking to the steps described in the tutorial, but when I cannot see my custom field type anywhere on my local JIRA instance. 
The command line window keeps throwing these errors:
*_[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.example.JiraCustomField': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 0 of type [com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CustomFieldValuePersister]: : No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CustomFieldValuePersister] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CustomFieldValuePersister] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}_*

which I can't seem to be able to fix adding 

*_<component-import key="customFieldValuePersister" interface="com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.CustomFieldValuePersister"/>_*
to my atlassian-plugin.xml, as descriibed here: https://developer.atlassian.com/docs/faq/troubleshooting/unsatisfieddependencyexception-error-creating-bean-with-name

Is this a bug or just lack of updated documentation with the last SDK version? Any help or insight on what could be going wrong would be appreciated.

Regards.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After the release of Project Types and new Application Access (Core and Software) in JIRA 7, there are two problems to access Release pages for anonymous users:
# Anonymous users no longer can see the icon to go to the Releases page of this project, though they strangely can use URL to go to it (if they know it).
# When they access this page via URL, clicking any version leads to an unaccessible page (the version hub for that version)

This is probably because development features are now only visible to Software users. However, this is highly inconsistent as an icon to an accessible page is gone, and once we manage to access the page, the links in it are not accessible.

Also, shouldn't public projects allow access to these pages to anonymous users?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a public software project (change Permission Scheme to add 'anyone' to the 'Browse Projects' permission)
# Access the project as an anonymous user (not logged in)
# In the project's left menu, the releases icon is not visible (*problem 1*):
!icon_gone.png|thumbnail!
# Since navigating to it is not possible, copy the URL to it and paste it (replace instance and project key):
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/PROJECTKEY?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page
{noformat}
#* Now we can see the page we couldn't access before
# Clicking a version leads to a page like this (*problem 2*):
!error.png|thumbnail!

It reads:
{panel}
Sorry, you can't view this page
This page is only available to JIRA Software users. If you think you should be a JIRA Software user, you should ask your administrator to give you application access to JIRA Software.
{panel}

h3. Expected Results
# All these pages are accessible (as this is a public project)
#* The icon is visible
#* The link to the version lead to an accessible page

h3. Actual Results
The ones described in the Steps to Reproduce.

h3. Notes
Also, the documentation is not reflecting these changes. What should public project show now to anonymous users? Only JIRA Core features or should it include JIRA Software?

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Access to Release Page on Public Projects

fields.description:
{panel}Original description by reporter -- Currently, if any issues in Sprint A in one board (Board A) got moved to Sprint B in another board (Board B), Sprint B will show up in the Velocity Report for Board A. 

It would be nice to limit sprints within a board in the Velocity Report. So no other sprints belonging to other boards should show up in the report. {panel}

h3. Summary

Velocity report include sprints from other boards. 

h3. Environment
* 2016-01-18 Cloud, 2016-02-01 Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Basically this might happen in the following scenario:
* You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint 1 with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. The Sprint 1 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.
* You have Board B with filter "project = B". You have Sprint 2 with issue B-1,B-2 inside it. The Sprint 2 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.

If issue A-1 is moved to Sprint B it means that Sprint B will contain 1 issue that match the filter of Board A, thus will make Sprint B APPEAR in board A. If that happen then the velocity report of board A will include Sprint B too. 

h3. Expected Results

Velocity Report should only show sprints from other boards if the issues were moved between active sprints, not in planning phase (between future sprints).
As moving issues to-from sprints affects velocity (committed/completed), the report should show it accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* The chart include Sprint outside the scope of the board, and Sprint might result empty. 

!velocity.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Velocity Report Should Only Show Sprints Related To The Current Board

 10701 | successfactors.n2             |     | mlavender   |             | SUC       |        0 |            3 |  10011 | SUC         | software
(29 rows)
{code}

Above, successfactors.n2 was created based on the configuration APPLE is using. Marty Test Two was created based on the configuration Marty Test One is using. In both instances each project resulted in a business board.

Switching the project type to business and then back to software does not correct the problem. Switching the project to a service desk project does result in a service desk project board however. Switching back to software from service desk changes the board back to a business board.

h3.Workaround
In your new project, under the project avatar in the sidebar, click the "Create Board" link. Create a new scrum or kanban board for an existing project, and make sure your current project is selected. The board and backlog will become available in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Creating a new Software project with shared configuration should copy board configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a field called fixVersion. Our versioning scheme is MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. Logically, and lexicographically, 4.1.3 precedes 4.2. Indeed this is the behavior I see in my board's filter, which has {{ORDER BY fixVersion ASC, priority DESC, issuetype ASC}}:

 !Screen Shot 2015-11-12 at 9.44.07 AM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2015-11-12 at 9.43.06 AM.png|thumbnail! 

However, when I look at the agile board, the sorting is different:

 !Screen Shot 2015-11-12 at 9.44.44 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Perhaps I'm missing something, but my understanding of [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/how-do-i-sort-the-backlog] is that the filter's sort will apply to the board. The sorts are _related_ - the other two fields sort as expected, but different in this way.

This is important to me because I want the team developers to see the patch release stuff (which is important but usually not fun) above the major release stuff.
fields.summary: Order of issues in agile board is different than when viewing the board's filter query directly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a basic [Smart Commit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+smart+commits] is performed on an issue, there will be no Issue Updated notification triggered, unless there are commands added, such as {{#comment}}, {{#time}} or {{#transition}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Basic Smart Commit should trigger an Issue Updated event as well 

h3. Workaround
Add any command for the commit to trigger notification
fields.summary: Notification for committed changeset

fields.description:
The Epic Name field is a mandatory field when creating Epic Issue Types.
However, if the user selects the Epic issue type to be the default issue type for a mail handler, JIRA  won't complain about the Epic Name being blank.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Setup a mail handler with the Epic issue type selected;
# Send a test email to this mail handler

*Expected*
JIRA would not create any issues from emails arriving the mail box because it's not possible to set the Epic Name in the mail handler.

*Actual*
A JIRA issue is created just fine using the message body and subject.
fields.summary: JIRA permits creation of Epic issue types through email with a blank Epic Name

fields.description:
Hello
This ticket is regarding "Software Simplified Workflow for Project RM" for https://harpercollinsuk.atlassian.net
Previously we had a workflow where once we create a ticket, the status would be "to do" (first screenshot attached- Jira ticket1110 harpercollins)

Now, the status "to do" was replaced by someone and is now labeled as "in progress'
I've tried to change this status back to "to do" but when I do it says there is already a status with this label/name.  (2nd screenshot- edit status)

When looking into the workflow scheme- it says this workflow is managed by Jira, Do not manually modify this workflow scheme.

+*(‘In  progress’ [with two spaces] needs to be changed to ‘To Do’)*+

+*Also it appears whatever changed also removed the following:
the other statuses that also no longer exist: “Awaiting review”, “Ready for Estimation”, and “Under analysis”.   
*+
We believe the updates maybe have been done by Donavan Grant in UK Harpercollins office. 



Could this have been updated by Jira software?

Please reach out to me asap as this is impacting many projects for HarperCollins.
914 299 0670 is my cell phone to contact me.   
         thanks
        Neeraj Sharma - 
Please cc grant.donovan@harpercollins.co.uk, and  fred.frenzel@harpercollins.com for any updates.
fields.summary: Jira workflow update affected all projects workflows

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing from JIRA Server to Cloud, if the JIRA Server has Agile in version with build number previous to '#45', the import will finish, apparently correctly, but with failed 'Software' features and alerting errors.
The following message is displayed in JIRA:
{quote}
JIRA Software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed.
Please contact your system administrator if you continue to see this message.
{quote}

The main concern is that for all the user knows, this import worked, as only errors in the logs are available, which are only accessible via Support. If the user misses or ignores the banner, they may insert new data and then a new import to fix this will make them lose the progress.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JIRA Server with Agile in version previous to build '#45'
# Do a full export and import in Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Importer warns that the import is not possible because the minimum version required for JIRA Agile is  6.7.12 as per [JIRA Agile 6.7 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.7+Upgrade+Notes]
Import process doesn't start

h3. Actual Results
Import process starts and fails. The site is locked.
JIRA loads an Access Error in the UI and the logs show:
{noformat}
Storing import result with error type: FAILED_VALIDATION
{noformat}

A few other times it may also show when starting JIRA after importing:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Version Report takes into account only the date when a Story is added to a version.
That said, if a completed story is added to a version the report will account the story points at the added date, not at the date the story was actually completed.
The story complete date is useful to track the team velocity, while the version added date does not seem to be useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be interesting to have this report showing the actual completion date Story instead of the date it was added to the version in case of a completed Story.
fields.summary: Version Report should better handle the Stories completion dates

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a board's filter uses category instead of project, while inside a project the board selector in the sidebar does not find the board

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create an issue filter like *category = "<project_category_name>" ORDER BY Rank ASC*
2. Create an agile board from existing filter and use the above created filter.
3. Navigate to one of the software projects that is part of that project category.
4. Click on the Board Picker to check whether the board created above is present or not.

Expected Result:
The board should be present.

Actual Result:
The board is not present.

Workaround:
Navigate to the board from the Boards drop-down in the header bar.
fields.summary: Board selector does not find boards using category

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Sprint Burndown_ gadget gets truncated  when shown with other gadgets on the Wallboard view

h3. Environment 
- JIRA Agile 7.0.2
- Firefox 42.0
- Safari 9.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new dashboard
# Add _Sprint Burndown_ gadget and add _Version report_ gadget
# Change the header color of one of the gadget.
# Tools -> View Wallboard slideshow

h3. Expected Result
_Sprint Burndown_ gadget is displayed properly

h3. Current Result
_Sprint Burndown_ gadget is cut off/truncated

h3. Note
The Sprint Burndown gadget also gets truncated on Dashboard when opened in Firefox.


h3. Temporarily Workaround
Try scrolling in and then out one or two times.
or
Use the same title color for all gadgets on the dashboard. This will however make only 1 gadget to show at a given instance and it will keep rotating between gadgets.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown gadget gets truncated when there is another gadget in wallboard view
